CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 28, 1959, pg. 1, reads: "They Will Represent Pittsburgh - Golden Gloves Kings - Negro fighters virtually dominated the Senior Open Division of the Golden Gloves finals held at Pitt Fieldhouse [sic] Monday night.  Left to right are the champions and their weights: Charlie Rose, 112 pounds; Jim Mathews, 118 pounds; Henry Culver, 126 pounds; Pat Deasy, 135 pounds; Walter Daniels, 160 pounds; James Hollis, 175 pounds, and heavyweight James T. Gilliam... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Boxers Charlie Rose, Jim Mathews or Matthews, Henry Culver, Pat Deasy, Walter Daniels, James Hollis, and James T. Gilliam posed in boxing ring in University of Pittsburgh Field House for Golden Gloves tournament
